b7fdfd4d08824fe8ae53984fbdae9c0a (02:09): is there a way to eliminate the space around the text in <div>  test </div> with CSS?

94066dc8bfb8043210f0e15b9be32d62 (02:09): subsonic , zip: Start every stylesheet with this: * { margin: 0; padding: 0; }. You'll save yourself the confusion over quite a few strange element and browser spacing differences later on.
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (02:10): HTML: Unable to validate http://aboumrad.koumbit.org/node/5: Could not contact validator
b7fdfd4d08824fe8ae53984fbdae9c0a (02:10): I'm talking about the fact that the display will show a " " before "test" if there's a space before it

03a383381d4ff12763ae056438665079 (02:11): subsonic: There's not a cross-browser way to eliminate a character that is there. You could, theoretically, give it a negative margin or something, but that would screw up subsequent lines and other stuff.
